channel.title: timesync sdwdate_error_handler /usr/lib/timesync/timesync_post_success
channel.description: whonix 12 Vbox fresh installation:- ERROR: timesync_post_error has been run with the following error text: ############################################ ## Error detected! Please report this bug! # ## ## BASH_SOURCE: /usr/lib/sdwdate/modules.d/sdwdate ## SDW_EXIT_ON_ERROR: 1 ## SDW_MODE: startup ## SDWDATE_SUBSHELL_SCLOCKADJ_EXIT_CODE: ## current_time: Mon Jan 25 08:57:16 UTC 2016 ## ## exit_code: 1 ## error_cause: sdwdate_error_handler signal ERR detected in line 1596 with BASH_COMMAND: /usr/lib/timesync/timesync_post_success --autostart --identifier "timesync" --progressbaridx "$ID" --mode "$SDW_MODE" --whoami "$who_ami" ############################################

item.title: timesync sdwdate_error_handler /usr/lib/timesync/timesync_post_success
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The workaround in meanwhile is to comment out or better overrule the timesync gui. That would disable the gui notification progress bar.

github.com

Whonix/timesync/blob/master/etc/sdwdate.d/31_timesync_plugin

## This file is part of Whonix.
## Copyright (C) 2012 - 2014 Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>
## See the file COPYING for copying conditions.

## Please use "/etc/sdwdate.d/50_sdwdate_user" for your custom
## configuration, which will override the defaults found here.
## When this package is updated, this file may be overwritten.

## Bash Fragment.

## Notification user.
## The user which receives notifications by sdwdate plugin timesync.
## If that user does not exist, the timesync plugin will do nothing when being
## run by sdwdate.
who_ami="user"

## See 30_sdwdate_default and /usr/lib/timesync/timesync_pre for a comment on the SDW_MODE variable.
DISPATCH_PRE='/usr/lib/timesync/timesync_pre --autostart --identifier "timesync" --progressbaridx "$ID" --mode "$SDW_MODE" --whoami "$who_ami"'

DISPATCH_POST_ERROR='/usr/lib/timesync/timesync_post_error --identifier "timesync" --progressbaridx "$ID" --mode "$SDW_MODE" --whoami "$who_ami" "$error_message" & disown'
This file has been truncated. show original

Regarding overruling, see:

Whonix

Whonix Configuration Files

Everything you should know about Whonix's Configuration Files.

Read full topic

item.description:

############################################
